description: Students continue learning Spanish in an intercultural context. The course continues to examine the Spanish-speaking world through exploration of topics, for example: cities and urban life; housing; and the historical roots of culinary traditions and food production. In-class speaking, listening, reading, and writing activities are complemented by attendance at two required culture tables. Offered each semester and January Term. Does not count toward Spanish major. Prerequisite: SPAN 111 or placement into SPAN 112.
name: Intro Spanish Language/World II
notes: Prerequisite: completion of Spanish placement test or preceding course.
title: Introduction to Spanish Language and the Spanish-Speaking World II
